title: Isn’t she lovely? Joyce Carol Oates: Christianity now ‘virtually synonymous w/ white nationalism’
text:
Isn’t she lovely? Joyce Carol Oates: Christianity now ‘virtually synonymous w/ white nationalism’ Posted at 7:55 pm on January 12, 2017 by Sarah D. Share on Facebook Share on Twitter 
It’s always cringeworthy when celebrated fiction writer Joyce Carol Oates tries to get real for a moment . But after all this time, she still hasn’t learned her lesson, which means she continues to bombard us with ignorant drivel like this: Those (of us) who could not believe in Christianity as a religion nonetheless believed that its tenets & ideals were noble, profound. But 
— Joyce Carol Oates (@JoyceCarolOates) January 13, 2017 @JoyceCarolOates what has happened to Christians in recent years! Virtually synonymous w/ white nationalism in many parts of country. 
— Joyce Carol Oates (@JoyceCarolOates) January 13, 2017 
Virtually synonymous, eh? 
— Cameron w Redfern (@redfern_cameron) January 13, 2017 
“Gross” being the operative word. Hate to break it to you, Joyce, but accusing others of bigotry rings awful hollow when you’re such a blatant bigot yourself. Trending
